data.title: Varun Dhawan Bio, Movies, Height, Age, Family, Net Worth & Wiki

data.text:
Varun Dhawan is a well-known Indian Bollywood actor, dancer, and model. Varun Dhawan was considered one of the nation’s most generously compensated celebrity. The country’s most paid celebrity, he has been on the Celebrity 100 list for Forbes India since 2014. Each of the eleven films in which he has performed has had commercial success, establishing Dhawan in the Hindi cinema.

Varun Dhawan was born in a Hindu family on 24 April 1987 in Mumbai. His father is David Dhawan who is a Bollywood film director. His mother’s name is Karuna Dhawan. He has an elder brother, Rohit Dhawan who is also a film director in Bollywood. Rohit is married to Jaanvi Desai, and they have a daughter. Varun’s uncle Anil Dhawan is also a Bollywood actor.

In an interview, Varun revealed his relationship with an anonymous girl when he was studying in the USA. At one point in time, his name was also linked with the actress Taapsee Pannu. At the time of Judwaa 2, they both were spotted spending quality time together. For almost a decade, he has been dating his childhood friend, Natasha Dalal, which he confirmed on the show ‘Koffee with Karan 6’ There was also a rumor that they had got engaged in a private ceremony.

Life Journey

Varun Dhawan completed his schooling from Bombay Scottish School, Mumbai. He completed his studies in Human Sciences at the H.R. College of Commerce and Economics. After that, he attended Nottingham Trent University in England, where he completed his graduation in Business Management. There, he also applied for a job in a London-based bank, but he got rejected. So, he decided to pursue his career in acting and returned to India where he joined Barry John’s acting school to brush up his acting skills.

Varun Dhawan assisted Karan Johar in the Bollywood film ‘My Name is Khan’ (2010), as an Assistant Director. Later, Karan Johar launched him as an actor in the Bollywood movie ‘Student of the year’ (2012) along with the newcomers Alia Bhatt, and Sidharth Malhotra. It became one of the highest-grossing Bollywood films of the year.

Siddhant Chaturvedi Bio, Age, Movies, Family, Height, Net Worth & Wiki

Varun Dhawan Net Worth

Talking about his residence and his cars, Varun Dhawan owns a house worth INR 20 crores in Mumbai. The ABCD 2 actor also owns an Audi Q7 that is worth INR 85 lakhs. These investments and his films have resulted in his net worth being $26 million.

Estimated Net Worth in 2023$26 Million Estimated Net Worth in 2022 (Approx)$17 Million Estimated Net Worth in 2021 (Approx)Under Review Annual SalaryUnder Review Income SourceActor, Model, Dancer

Apart from the films, he has also done some brand endorsements for Frooti, Skybags, and Navratna. Talking about expensive things Varun Dhawan owns, the SOTY actor reportedly spent a whopping INR 13 lakhs on his Polaris Sportsman 850 bike. Varun also owns a Harley Davidson FatBoy that is worth INR 18.15 lakhs. Varun Dhawan also seems to be a fan of watches, the Kalank actor owns a Piguet Royal Oak Offshore Chronograph watch that is worth INR 20 lakhs.

Career

Varun Dhawan was next seen in the 2014 comedy film ‘Main Tera Hero’ where he played the lead role. The film was directed by his father David Dhawan. It revolved around the adventures of a mischievous young guy. In the same year, he also played the lead role in the movie ‘Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania.’ It became one of the highest-grossing films of the year.

In 2015, he played the lead role in the crime thriller film ‘Badlapur.’ In the film, which was directed by Sriram Raghavan, Dhawan portrayed a man seeking revenge for the death of his family. The film did well commercially. It earned him a ‘Filmfare’ nomination for ‘Best Actor.’ He then played the main role in the film ‘ABCD 2.’ Like all his previous films, this film too was a commercial success.

Swara Bhaskar Bio, Age, Family, Movies, TV Shows, Net Worth & Wiki

Varun Dhawan was then seen alongside popular actor Shahrukh Khan in the 2015 romantic action film ‘Dilwale.’ The film was directed and co-produced by Rohit Shetty. It was a huge commercial success, grossing nearly Rs. 400 crore.

In 2016, Along with John Abraham, Varun Dhawan played the lead role Indian action comedy ‘Dishoom!’ Directed by Rohit Dhawan, the film revolved around two officers searching for an Indian cricket player who goes missing. He was next seen in the 2017 romantic comedy ‘Badrinath Ki Dulhania.’ The film was directed by Shashank Khaitan. It was a huge commercial success.

Dhawan was next seen in the film ‘Judwaa 2’ where he played a dual role. The film was directed by his father David Dhawan and is a reboot of the 1997 film ‘Judwaa.’ It also starred Jacqueline Fernandez, Taapsee Pannu, Anupam Kher, Sachin Khedekar, Prachi Shah, Rajpal Yadav, and Zakir Hussain. The story revolved around the adventures of twin brothers separated at birth. The film was a huge commercial success.

In 2018, he was seen in the movie ‘October.’ In the same year, he was also seen in the comedy-drama film ‘Sui Dhaaga’ alongside Anushka Sharma. He portrayed the role of ‘Zafar’ in the 2019 film ‘Kalank.’ The same year, he was cast to play ‘Raju’ in the comedy film ‘Coolie No. 1.’ In the following year, he was seen playing ‘Sahej’ in Remo D’Souza’s musical dance drama film ‘Street Dancer 3D.’

Facts About Varun Dhawan

Does Varun Dhawan drink alcohol?: Yes

Does He smoke?: No

In an interview, Varun revealed that his grandfather used to work at the HSBC bank in Hongkong.

Since his childhood, Varun has been a huge fan of wrestling and he idolizes the famous wrestler Dwayne Johnson– ‘The Rock.’ Once, The Rock wished Varun on his birthday on Twitter which was requested by Varun’s fans. Varun is surprised when he received a birthday wish from Dwayne Johnson.

Reportedly, when he was studying in London, he worked as a leaflet distributor for nightclubs.

He loved the acting skills of co-actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui in Badlapur, and he got inspired by Nawaz to brush up his acting skills.

Varun has been featured on the cover of many prestigious magazines including the GQ Magazine, which featured him on its cover with the title “Most Bankable star of his generation”.

On 30 January 2018, he unveiled his wax statue at Madame Tussauds (Hong Kong). The statue is posing in his iconic step of the song ‘Disco Deewane’. He is one of the youngest stars to get such a statue.

He learned stitching and embroidery for his movie ‘Sui Dhaga’ with co-star Anushka Sharma, in 2018. On his father’s birthday, he stitched a shirt and gifted it to him.

His Jodi with the actress Alia Bhatt is considered as the next generation’s ‘Shah Rukh Khan – Kajol’ Jodi.

Reportedly, he had cut down his fees to half for the movie ‘October’ 2018, directed by Shoojit Sircar, as the budget was low for the film.

In 2018, he welcomed a new member of his family- his niece and shared the news on social media sites.

He fell in a Twitter fight with Kangana‘s sister Rangoli for not mentioning Kangana’s name in his tweet after watching the trailer of the film ‘Judgemental Hai Kya.’

Varun is a gym freak and is inspired by Sylvester Stallone and Arnold Schwarzenegger.

He likes to spend his leisure time with dogs.
